message.content:
cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the problem of sorting permutations, which is a fundamental topic in computer science. The use of circular transpositions suggests a connection to permutation groups and combinatorics, which are covered by cs.DM and cs.CC. The upper bound on the number of transpositions needed involves the size of the permutation, which is a typical feature of algorithms and data structures, covered by cs.DS. The problem of sorting permutations can also be formulated as an optimization problem, which is related to mathematical programming and numerical analysis, covered by cs.NA. Finally, the paper involves some theoretical analysis and proofs, which are typical of the field of graph theory, covered by cs.GT.
